org.apache.lucene.analysis.util

Class FilteringTokenFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.util.AttributeSource
      • org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenStream
        • org.apache.lucene.analysis.TokenFilter
          • org.apache.lucene.analysis.FilteringTokenFilter
            • org.apache.lucene.analysis.util.FilteringTokenFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Deprecated. 
    This class moved to Lucene-Core module: FilteringTokenFilter

    @Deprecated
public abstract class FilteringTokenFilter
extends FilteringTokenFilter
    Abstract base class for TokenFilters that may remove tokens. You have to implement FilteringTokenFilter.accept() and return a boolean if the current token should be preserved. FilteringTokenFilter.incrementToken() uses this method to decide if a token should be passed to the caller.
